intro: Neomanniophyton thonneri, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, emitting a sweet fragrance to attract nocturnal pollinators. Its leaves are typically ovate and arranged oppositely along the stem. Neomanniophyton thonneri is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique blooming habit.
